title: PPEC Centers (Prescribed Pediatric Extended Care)
shortDescription: Medical daycare facilities providing skilled nursing, therapy, and developmental services for medically complex children.
description: Prescribed Pediatric Extended Care (PPEC) centers are licensed medical daycare facilities that provide comprehensive care for children with complex medical needs. Unlike traditional daycares, PPECs are staffed with registered nurses, licensed practical nurses, and certified nursing assistants who can administer medications, manage feeding tubes, provide respiratory support, and monitor medical conditions. Many PPECs also offer on-site therapy services including physical therapy, occupational therapy, and speech therapy. PPEC care is typically covered 100% by Florida Medicaid for eligible children, with no copays or out-of-pocket costs for families.
benefits: Skilled nursing care throughout the day
100% covered by Florida Medicaid for eligible children
Up to 12 hours of daily care
Respite for caregivers of medically complex children
Trained staff for feeding tubes, trachs, and other medical equipment
whoCanBenefit: Children birth through age 20 with medically complex conditions
Children requiring ongoing skilled nursing care
Those with feeding tubes or specialized feeding needs
Children needing respiratory support or oxygen
Those with seizure disorders requiring monitoring
Children with multiple disabilities requiring medical oversight
Families eligible for Florida Medicaid (including Katie Beckett/TEFRA waiver)
whatToExpect: Initial assessment by nursing staff to develop care plan
Daily nursing care and medical monitoring
Therapy sessions integrated into the day
Developmental activities appropriate to your child's abilities
Regular communication with families about progress
Transportation to and from the center (at many locations)
eligibility: Child must be Florida Medicaid eligible
Must have a 'medically complex' or 'medically fragile' designation
